intro: Maripa villosa, commonly known as the hairy maripa, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. The plant is not only ornamental but also has some traditional uses in local communities.
